Floating, resizable CSS editor with live preview

üëâ Look in the top-right corner!

You should see a </> button. Click it to open the floating CSS editor.

üì¶ How to Embed in Your CX1 Site

Add this single line to the <head> section of your CX1 site:

<script src="https://benelliot-nice.sgp1.digitaloceanspaces.com/media/misc/expert-css/css-editor-embed.js"></script>

That's it! The editor will automatically load and create a floating toggle button.

‚ú® Features

  • Floating Overlay: Editor appears as an overlay on top of your site
  • Draggable: Drag the editor by its header to reposition it anywhere on screen
  • Resizable: Drag the bottom-right corner to resize the editor window
  • Live Preview: See your CSS changes reflected immediately in the page
  • Monaco Editor: Full VS Code editor with syntax highlighting and linting
  • Multi-editor Support: Edit multiple role-based CSS files simultaneously
  • Auto-save to localStorage: Your changes persist across page reloads
  • Dirty State Tracking: Visual indicators (‚úì/‚óè) show saved vs unsaved changes
  • Mobile Responsive: Adapts to smaller screens automatically

üéØ Try It Now!

  1. Click the </> button in the top-right corner
  2. Click one of the role buttons (e.g., "All Roles") to activate an editor
  3. Type some CSS in the editor (try: body { background: red !important; })
  4. Watch the page background change in real-time!
  5. Drag the editor window around by its purple header
  6. Resize the window by dragging the bottom-right corner
  7. Click the minimize button or toggle button to hide the editor
